column1: UINL Component Classes (i.e., GUI widget types)

column4: Short Description
root container refers to the entire UI display; it is a special "bin" that has no id and cannot be deleted
generic container (functionally equivalent to HTML div)
generic UTF8 text or text input
numeric item or numeric input; may have options for range, step-size, and unit type
clickable button
hold-down button (different from "btn" in that it sends events both when it is down and when it is released)
option; this is a selectable and deselectable item (e.g., checkbox, radio button, selection)
amount of time (in seconds)
date-time field; specifies date and/or time of day; this item's value represents number of seconds since epoch

mathematical value or formula; a special text item that follows AsciiMath syntax; Note: use "i" (character i in double-quotes) or UTF character â…ˆ to denote imaginary number (i.e., square root of -1)
embedded document -- text with markup syntax; default markup language is HTML (use "fmt" property to change markup language; e.g., use "fmt":"md" for markdown syntax)
file chooser
color; a special text item whose value is a 6-character hexadecimal value, representing RGB color
dropdown container (usually dropdown menu)
context container (usually context menu)
floating window or modal popup or toast
a container with one child whose content is visible and other children whose content is hidden (usually represented to humans as tabs, accordion, or a carousel)
grid (i.e., table); each child of this container is a "bin" which represents a table row, and each of its children are row cells
grid cell merged with a cell to its left -- a special blank item inside a table row, indicating that an item directly to its left spans rightward into this cell's space
grid cell merged with a cell above it -- a special blank item inside a table row, indicating that an item directly above it spans downward into this cell's space
inline frame displaying external resources
embedded playable media (e.g., audio, video, slideshow)
2d plot chart
data series (displayed as a standalone 2d plot, or overlapping with other data series inside a "plot" item)
data point inside a "data" item
2d graphical viewport
3d graphical viewport
a group of "gr" items
graphical node or shape, potentially with lines/arrows connecting to other graphical nodes
line/link connecting its parent "gr" item to another item in current viewport
